required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Non-Invasive Monitoring Parameter in a Hospital Setting
clinical_study.official_title: A Novel Cardio-Respiratory Parameter in a Hospital Setting

brief_summary.textblock: Data collected from this study will be used to evaluate the performance of a monitoring algorithm.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this study is to assess equivalency, performance, and accuracy of a new monitoring algorithm in a hospital setting.

primary_outcome.measure: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Determine Respiration Rate Measured as Mean and Standard Deviation With Accuracy That is Non-inferior to Predicate Device.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitored for average of 30 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Mean and standard deviations of respiration rates collected from patients in the hospital settings were compared between Covidien Respiration Rate Software, Transthoracic Impedance and End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms. Each patient served as its own control.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Calculate Respiration Rate With a Root Mean Square Difference (RMSD) of < 3 Breaths Per Minute Compared With a End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms, With 95% Confidence.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitored on average for 30 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: The data used for analysis consisted of multiple simultaneous measures of RR_TTI, RR_V1.0 and RR_EtCO2 for each subject. Given N sets of simultaneous RR values for each of P patients, the simultaneous RR values were used to calculate a pair of RMSD values for each subject. The two RMSD values, RMSDRR_V1.0_vs_EtCO2, and RMSDTTI_vs_EtCO2, quantify the mean absolute difference in simultaneous estimates of respiratory rate between RR_V1.0 compared with RR_EtCO2 and RR_TTI compared with RR_EtCO2, respectively for the subjects with 95% confidence of mean ± 3.38 BrPM. The Measure type is Number and represents the RMSD of Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software

arm_group.description: In-patients from the hospital who choose to participate in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects 18 years old or older
2. Written informed consent from the patient or their legally authorized representative before initiation of any study-related procedures
3. Subjects on general care floor
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Severe contact allergies to standard adhesive materials
2. Abnormalities that may prevent proper application of the device
3. Women who are pregnant or lactating
4. Subjects with significant arrhythmia

overall_official.affiliation: The Ohio State Medical Center, Dept of Anesthesia
University of Colorado Denver, School of Medicine dept of Surgery Division of GI, Tumor and Endocrine Surgery

facility.name: The University of Colorado Health Sciences Center (UCHSC)
The Ohio State University Medical Center (OSUMC)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment dates were February 10, 2011- to March 4th,2011

group.title: Respiration Rate in GCF Patients
group.description: In-patients from the hospital general care floor, who choose to participate in the study. Participants were monitored for 30 minute periods to collect respiratory rate information from non-invasive sensors.

participants_list.participants: Total of 10 subjects were excluded from analysis

group.title: In-patient Volunteers
group.description: In-patients from the hospital who choose to participate in the study

outcome.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Determine Respiration Rate Measured as Mean and Standard Deviation With Accuracy That is Non-inferior to Predicate Device.
outcome.description: Mean and standard deviations of respiration rates collected from patients in the hospital settings were compared between Covidien Respiration Rate Software, Transthoracic Impedance and End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms. Each patient served as its own control.
outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitored for average of 30 minutes
outcome.population: 10 participants were excluded from data analysis due to following reasons: unreadable files,arrhythmia,electronic data files coud not be processed

group.title: Respiration Rate From Covidien Respiration Rate Software
group.description: Respiration rate determined by novel plethysmographic analysis

group.title: Respiration Rate From Endtidal Carbon Dioxide Waveform
group.description: Respiration rate determined by manual overscoring of capnography waveforms

group.title: Respiration Rate From Transthoracic Impedance
group.description: Respiration Rate derived from Transthoracic Impedance

measure.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Determine Respiration Rate Measured as Mean and Standard Deviation With Accuracy That is Non-inferior to Predicate Device.
measure.description: Mean and standard deviations of respiration rates collected from patients in the hospital settings were compared between Covidien Respiration Rate Software, Transthoracic Impedance and End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms. Each patient served as its own control.
measure.population: 10 participants were excluded from data analysis due to following reasons: unreadable files,arrhythmia,electronic data files coud not be processed

outcome.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Calculate Respiration Rate With a Root Mean Square Difference (RMSD) of < 3 Breaths Per Minute Compared With a End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms, With 95% Confidence.
outcome.description: The data used for analysis consisted of multiple simultaneous measures of RR_TTI, RR_V1.0 and RR_EtCO2 for each subject. Given N sets of simultaneous RR values for each of P patients, the simultaneous RR values were used to calculate a pair of RMSD values for each subject. The two RMSD values, RMSDRR_V1.0_vs_EtCO2, and RMSDTTI_vs_EtCO2, quantify the mean absolute difference in simultaneous estimates of respiratory rate between RR_V1.0 compared with RR_EtCO2 and RR_TTI compared with RR_EtCO2, respectively for the subjects with 95% confidence of mean ± 3.38 BrPM. The Measure type is Number and represents the RMSD of Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software
outcome.time_frame: Participants were monitored on average for 30 minutes

group.title: Overall Study Population
group.description: Covidien Respiration Rate, Transthoracic Impedance and Overscored Endtidal Carbon Dioxide derived respiration rates were recorded on all the volunteers simultaneously.

measure.title: The Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software Shall Calculate Respiration Rate With a Root Mean Square Difference (RMSD) of < 3 Breaths Per Minute Compared With a End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide Waveforms, With 95% Confidence.
measure.description: The data used for analysis consisted of multiple simultaneous measures of RR_TTI, RR_V1.0 and RR_EtCO2 for each subject. Given N sets of simultaneous RR values for each of P patients, the simultaneous RR values were used to calculate a pair of RMSD values for each subject. The two RMSD values, RMSDRR_V1.0_vs_EtCO2, and RMSDTTI_vs_EtCO2, quantify the mean absolute difference in simultaneous estimates of respiratory rate between RR_V1.0 compared with RR_EtCO2 and RR_TTI compared with RR_EtCO2, respectively for the subjects with 95% confidence of mean ± 3.38 BrPM. The Measure type is Number and represents the RMSD of Covidien Nellcor Respiration Rate Software

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
